author: Derek Decloet
description: General Motors Co. and Stellantis NV will be forced to pay tariffs on some US-made vehicles exported to Canada after the companies decided to move some production out of factories in Ontario.
title: GM, Stellantis to Lose Part of Canada Tariff Break on US Autos

author: Nazmul Ahasan
description: Applications for US unemployment benefits rose last week, according to analyses of unadjusted state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.
title: US Initial Jobless Claims Rose Last Week, State Data Suggest

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration is readying a proposal to open almost all US coastal waters to new offshore oil drilling despite opposition from state governors and the president’s previous efforts to close off some of the territory.
title: Trump Plans to Open Almost All of US Coast to Offshore Drilling

author: Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump said “the land is going to be next” in his campaign to halt the flow of drugs into the US from Venezuela, the clearest indication yet that he’s preparing to broaden strikes that have so far been limited to targets at sea.
title: Trump Says US Will Shift to Strikes on Land After Boat Attacks

author: Polly Mosendz, Michael Smith, Rachel Adams-Heard
description: Nana Regional Corp. is supposed to uphold Iñupiat values. Some shareholders say its role in Trump’s deportation machinery makes a mockery of that.
title: Distant ICE Detention Centers Bring Money—and Anger—to an Alaska Native Community

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Raising the quota for beef imports brings complaints from ranchers.
title: Trump Stirs Up a Fight With Ranchers Over Argentine Beef

author: Lily Meier, Kristina Peterson, Aashna Shah
description: The political firestorm over the looming cutoff in food-aid funding intensified Thursday as lawmakers from both parties sounded alarms and some states warned retailers of its consequences.
title: Firestorm Over Food Stamps Erupts With Funds Set to Expire

author: Caitlin Reilly, Georgia Hall
description: Virginia lawmakers are looking to redraw the state’s congressional maps, the latest push by Democrats as the party seeks to counter similar moves by Republicans in the race to win a House majority in the 2026 midterms.
title: Virginia Democrats Seek to Redraw House Maps in 2026 Midterm Push

author: Alberto Nardelli, Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union punted until December a decision on whether to tap frozen Russian central bank assets to aid Ukraine, after Belgium demanded greater assurances that it wouldn’t be held liable for risks linked to the €140 billion ($163 billion) loans.
title: EU Leaders Defer Russian Frozen Asset Plan Decision to December

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney hopes to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit next week as he tries to offset US tariffs by easing trade tensions with the world’s second-largest economy.
title: Carney Hopes to Meet China’s Xi Soon in Bid to Ease Trade Tensions

author: Joe Deaux, Josh Wingrove, Ryan Gould
description: The Trump administration is in early-stage conversations with quantum computing companies to discuss potential financial support for an industry that’s part of the growing race with China for technology supremacy.
title: US Weighs Quantum Computing Boost in Effort to Counter China

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Samy Adghirni, Jorge Valero
description: French President Emmanuel Macron told European Union leaders to consider using the bloc’s most powerful trade tool against China if they aren’t able to find a resolution to Beijing’s planned export controls on critical raw materials.
title: Macron Tells EU to Weigh Using Strongest Trade Tool on China

author: Ben Steverman, Biz Carson
description: California billionaires would face a one-time 5% tax on their wealth through a ballot initiative that advocates say could bring in about $100 billion to cover state health-care costs.
title: California Billionaires Face a Proposed 5% Tax on Wealth

author: Kate Sullivan, Lauren Dezenski
description: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will meet next Thursday on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit, the White House announced, as the leaders of the world’s two largest economies look to deescalate a simmering trade war.
title: Trump, Xi to Meet Next Thursday at APEC Summit, White House Says

author: Andra Timu, Andrea Palasciano, Olesia Safronova
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he won’t recognize any territorial swaps during potential peace negotiations with Russia as he tries to rally financial support from European allies.
title: Ukraine Refuses to Accept Lands Swap With Russia, Zelenskiy Says

author: Erik Wasson
description: Senate Democrats blocked a Republican measure aimed at paying military troops and some federal workers during the US government shutdown in the latest sign the spending deadlock shows no sign of ending.
title: Democrats Block Senate Bill to Pay Some Workers During Shutdown

author: Fiona MacDonald
description: Kuwait’s Oil Minister said that OPEC is prepared to increase oil production if demand requires it.
title: Kuwait Says OPEC Nations Are Ready to Hike Output If Called Upon

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Two Russian fighter jets made an 18-second incursion into Lithuanian airspace on Thursday, the country’s armed forces said.
title: Two Russian Jets Violate Lithuanian Airspace for 18 Seconds

author: Max Ramsay, Oliver Crook
description: European Union countries should use funds from its €150 billion ($174 billion) investment plan for the bloc’s defense industry to help Ukraine, according to Defense Commissioner Andrius Kubilius.
title: EU Defense Chief Urges Use of Investment Loans to Help Ukraine

author: Felipe Marques
description: San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie said President Donald Trump is calling off a deployment of federal forces to the city, less than 24 hours after reports that the White House was sending more than 100 border patrol officers to the San Francisco Bay area.
title: San Francisco Mayor Says Trump Calling Off Federal Crackdown

author: Caitlin Reilly, David Gura, Alicia Diaz
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries teased a public endorsement in the hotly contested New York City mayor’s race in coming days, praising Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani’s commitment to leaving the current police commissioner in place.
title: Jeffries Teases New York Mayoral Endorsement, Praises Mamdani on NYPD

author: Pius Lukong, Yinka Ibukun
description: Cameroonian authorities blamed an internet disruption in the central African nation that’s facing post-election unrest on a submarine cable cut.
title: Cameroon Blames Internet Outage on Cable Cut as Protests Erupt

author: David Pan
description: Binance Coin, a cryptocurrency also known as BNB that is the main transactional token on its namesake digital asset platform,  jumped as much as 8% after exchange co-founder Changpeng Zhao received a pardon from President Donald Trump.
title: Binance’s Token Surges After Founder Zhao Is Pardoned by Trump

author: Ntando Thukwana, Rivaldo Jantjies
description: South Africa needs to fast-track structural reforms to cushion the economy from the effects of US President Donald Trump’s punishing tariffs, the country’s central bank said.
title: South Africa Needs Reforms to Counter US Tariffs, Central Bank Says

author: Stephen Wicary, Hannah Levitt
description: Argentine President Javier Milei will meet with Jamie Dimon during the JPMorgan Chase & Co. chief executive’s visit to Buenos Aires this week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Milei to Meet Dimon, Speak to CEOs Two Days Before Key Election

author: Allyson Versprille, Erik Wasson
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy warned that flight disruptions would continue across the US as the government shutdown drags into its fourth week.
title: Trump Team Warns of More Flight Delays If US Shutdown Continues

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Binance co-founder Changpeng Zhao has received a pardon from President Donald Trump after he went to jail for failing to safeguard the world’s largest crypto exchange against money laundering.
title: Binance Founder Zhao Pardoned by Trump in Latest Crypto Clemency

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Ayandeh Bank, one of Iran’s largest commercial lenders, has been dissolved in a state take-over that’s exposed major failings in a globally isolated sector dogged by bad debts and weak regulation.
title: One of Iran’s Biggest Banks Fails Amid Push to Tighten Standards

author: Georgia Hall, Laura Nahmias
description: Eric Adams will endorse Andrew Cuomo for New York City mayor, a reversal for the incumbent mayor after he accused his former challenger of being a “snake and a liar” just weeks ago in the contentious battle for Gracie Mansion.
title: New York City Mayor Adams Endorses Cuomo After Final Debate

author: Jack Sidders
description: The UK’s Ministry of Housing Communities and Local Government has confirmed a package of measures designed to boost housebuilding in London following a collapse in new development.
title: UK Unveils Emergency Housing Plan to Boost London Development

author: Philip Sanders
description: Argentine bonds gained for only the second time in six sessions on Thursday, while the peso strengthened for a second day ahead of crucial midterm elections this weekend.
title: Argentine Bonds and Peso Rally Ahead of Crucial Vote for Milei

author: Michael Hirtzer, Erin Ailworth
description: Beijing’s bid to pressure the president leaves US farmers without their biggest customer, just as harvest gets underway.
title: China’s Soybean Feud With Trump Leaves US Farmers With Huge Crops and Few Buyers

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia anticipates a hit to the state budget from US sanctions against the country’s two largest oil producers over the war in Ukraine, though officials say they’re confident they’ll find ways to mitigate the impact of the measures.
title: Russia Seeks Oil Sanctions Workaround to Offset Hit to Budget

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Josh Xiao
description: A recently-concluded conclave of top Communist Party officials saw its lowest attendance rate since the years of the Cultural Revolution more than half a century ago, suggesting President Xi Jinping’s anti-corruption could be wider than publicly known.
title: China Plenum Turnout Hits Lowest in Decades as Xi Widens Purges

author: Bailey Lipschultz
description: Hundreds of the blank-check companies have sprouted since Trump’s return to office, and many of them dovetail with his agenda.
title: SPACs Are Back, and MAGA Is Fueling Their Growth

author: Sachin Ravikumar, Alex Wickham
description: British police have arrested three men in London under national security laws on suspicion of helping Russia’s intelligence services.
title: UK Police Arrest Three Men on Russia Spying Suspicions

author: Kirsi Heikel, Ott Tammik
description: Finland will host a summit for leaders of countries on the European Union’s eastern flank to push their common messaging on defense initiatives.
title: Finland to Host December Summit for EU Eastern Flank Nations

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he plans to run for a fourth term in the 2026 election without making his bid for reelection contingent on his health.
title: Brazil’s Lula Confirms He’ll Seek Reelection in 2026

author: John Liu, Josh Xiao
description: After President Xi Jinping ousted a group of top generals whose careers overlapped for decades, state media accused them of “severely undermining” the Communist Party’s highest echelons of authority.
title: China Military Purge Targets Group Who Undermined Xi’s Authority

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany expects total tax revenue through 2029 to be €33.6 billion ($39 billion) higher than what it predicted in May, as Europe’s biggest economy plans to spend hundreds of billions of euros in the coming years to revive growth.
title: Germany Sees €33.6 Billion More Total Tax Revenues Through 2029

author: Paul Burkhardt
description: South Africa’s 440 billion rand ($25 billion) transmission grid expansion program has attracted interest from international developers, including a company owned by Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and Chinese firms.
title: South Africa’s $25 Billion Grid Build Draws Adani, Chinese Firms

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Trump has repeatedly touted his “very good relationship” with the North Korean leader.
title: An Emboldened Kim Nudges Trump for a Sitdown

author: Sarah Jacob, Patrick Van Oosterom, William Wilkes
description: Vincent Karremans had been guiding Dutch economic policy in a caretaker role for a little over three months, when the former entrepreneur elbowed aside a chipmaker’s Chinese owners and escalated a geopolitical spat that threatens another blow to Europe’s economy.
title: Dutch-China Chip Spat Risks Hit to Europe Automotive Production

author: Charlie Zhu, Ocean Hou
description: Beijing has warned that the UK’s “politicization” of Chinese business deals could impact companies’ decisions to invest further in the country, as a slew of incidents roil relations between the two nations.
title: China Warns Against ‘Politicization’ of Investment Deals in UK

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Josh Xiao
description: China promoted Zhang Shengmin on the Central Military Commission as vice chair, replacing the nation’s former No. 2 general who was kicked out of the Communist Party last week.
title: China Names Military Anti-Graft Buster as Nation’s No. 2 General

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s supporters kicked off a day of rallies in Budapest that will be a test of political strength less than six months before pivotal Hungarian elections.
title: Orban’s Supporters Rally in Test of Strength for Hungarian Vote

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: Belgian Prime Minister Bart De Wever warned he would sink the plan to tap frozen Russian central bank assets unless other European Union countries agree to share the risk, setting the stage for fraught EU leaders’ talks on how to finance Ukraine.
title: Belgium Threatens to Block Russian Asset Plan If Risk Not Shared

author: Takako Taniguchi, Akemi Terukina
description: New Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi will push for the establishment of an official group to monitor whether investments and takeover bids from abroad pose security risks.
title: Takaichi Seeks Japan Group to Ward Off Risky Foreign Investors

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump’s upcoming trip to Asia caps a whirlwind stretch that includes jetting to the Middle East to mark the Israel-Hamas ceasefire, escalating a trade clash with China, redoubling efforts to send troops to US cities and overseeing construction of a $300 million White House ballroom.
title: Trump Bypasses Shutdown Fight to Focus on Ceasefires, Ballroom

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Political tensions risk undoing the economic gains from Turkey’s return to orthodox policies, Moody’s Ratings said, warning renewed unrest may rattle investors and complicate monetary policy.
title: Moody’s Warns Political Risks Threaten Turkey’s Economic Gains

author: Francine Lacqua, Mark Schroers
description: Germany should finally get the top job at the European Central Bank when Christine Lagarde’s term as president ends in late 2027, according to a former economic adviser to Chancellor Angela Merkel.
title: Time for a German to Head ECB, Former Merkel Adviser Says

author: Dan Williams
description: Right-wing rivals of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu narrowly passed a West Bank annexation bill in a first parliamentary reading, drawing remonstration from the US as the allies try to implement a Gaza peace plan whose regional support hinges on acknowledging Palestinian territorial claims.
title: Netanyahu Party Rebuffs Rivals’ Annexation Bill as ‘Trolling’

author: Jack Farchy
description: The US government has invested in a new fund to invest in critical minerals alongside Orion Resource Partners and Abu Dhabi’s ADQ.
title: US Forms Critical Minerals Fund With Orion Targeting $5 Billion

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Two police officers were hospitalized and 23 arrests were made during a second night of violent anti-immigration rioting in Dublin Wednesday night.
title: Dublin Anti-Immigration Protests Flare Up For Second Night

author: Erica Yokoyama, Keiko Ujikane
description: Japan’s largest labor union federation will keep seeking at least a 5% wage hike in next year’s pay talks, as new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi attempts to keep the country’s wage momentum going.
title: Japan’s Unions Seek Minimum 5% Wage Hike in Upcoming Pay Talks

author: Paul Abelsky, Josh Xiao
description: China said Vice Premier He Lifeng plans to meet with US officials in Kuala Lumpur from Oct. 24 to 27 for the next round of trade talks, aimed at defusing a standoff between the world’s two largest economies.
title: China Says Trade Talks With US Set for Friday in Malaysia

author: William Standring
description: Polls have opened in a by-election that threatens to lay bare the fracturing of British politics, pitting Nigel Farage’s populist Reform UK party against the Welsh nationalists of Plaid Cymru, with Keir Starmer’s Labour vying to keep a seat they’ve always held.
title: Welsh By-Election Highlights Risk for Starmer Amid Fracturing Vote

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union adopted a new package of sanctions targeting Russia’s energy infrastructure, joining a new US push to chip away at Moscow’s ability to wage its war against Ukraine.
title: EU Adopts New Sanctions Package That Targets Russian Energy

author: Colum Murphy, Yujing Liu, Stephen Engle
description: Former Morgan Stanley Asia chairman Stephen Roach said China must target consumption accounting for half of economic output over the next decade, joining a growing chorus of calls from economists worried about the Asian nation’s outlook.
title: China Must Set ‘Aggressive’ Consumption Goal, Stephen Roach Says

author: Ewa Krukowska, John Ainger, Petra Sorge
description: EU leaders need to find a way to ease the cost burden of the green transition for companies and consumers while keeping climate ambition intact.
title: Europe Faces an Economic Reality Check on Its Climate Agenda

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Thailand’s Foreign Minister Sihasak Phuangketkeow said his country will sign a “joint declaration” with Cambodia to defuse a border dispute that escalated into deadly clashes earlier this year.
title: Thailand, Cambodia to Sign Pact on Border Row at Asean Summit

author: Rakesh Sharma
description: Flows of Russian oil to major Indian refiners — a boon for both countries’ economies over the past three years — are expected to fall to near zero after the US imposed sanctions on crude giants Rosneft PJSC and Lukoil PJSC.
title: India’s Russian Oil Bounty Dries Up as Sanctions Toughen

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Newly appointed Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi started off her term with high approval ratings, in a show of optimism that she could deliver on her pledges that include countering inflation and strengthening the economy.
title: Japanese PM Takaichi’s Government Kicks Off With Strong Support

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea said it successfully tested a new hypersonic weapon system in its latest show of force “against potential enemies” as world leaders, including President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, prepare to gather in South Korea for the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit next week.
title: North Korea Says Tested New Hypersonic Missiles to Deter Enemies

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s Congress voted in favor of confirming President José Jerí’s top minister and cabinet, an early sign of support as the new administration vows to tackle crime.
title: Peru’s Congress Backs President Jerí’s New PM And Cabinet

author: Toru Fujioka, Cynthia Li
description: Bank of Japan watchers pushed back their forecast for the next interest rate hike timing in a dramatic shift from last month, with only a few expecting a move next week, according to the latest Bloomberg survey.
title: BOJ Watchers Push Back Rate Hike Call After Takaichi Takes Helm

author: Netty Idayu Ismail
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi will skip a regional leaders summit in Kuala Lumpur, missing out on a possible meeting with US President Donald Trump.
title: Modi to Skip Asean Summit, Missing Out on Possible Trump Meeting

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Andrew Cuomo sought to cast Zohran Mamdani as a frontrunner unprepared to actually be mayor of the largest US city in the final debate before New York City’s mayoral election.
title: Cuomo Seeks to Halt Mamdani Momentum in Final NYC Mayoral Debate
